name: John L. Brooks
bio: John L. Brooks is a chef, author, and food activist. She is the founder of Chez Panisse restaurant in Berkeley, California, and has been a leading advocate for locally sourced, organic food for decades.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.method: Marinate the chicken in the yogurt for at least 1 hour. In a large skillet, heat the ghee over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute. Add the spices and cook for another minute. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Add the tomato sauce and bring to a simmer. Cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 10 minutes. Stir in the cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice and naan bread.

recipes.name: Mughlai Chicken
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, marinate the chicken with yogurt, cream, ginger paste, garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions and fry until golden brown. Add marinated chicken and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the gravy has thickened. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Vegetable Samosas
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, 2 tablespoons oil, and salt. Add water gradually, and knead to make a smooth dough. Cover with a damp cloth and set aside for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add cumin and coriander seeds, and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add mixed vegetables, turmeric, garam masala, cayenne pepper, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Remove from heat and stir in ginger, garlic, lemon juice, and cilantro.Divide the dough into small balls. Roll out each ball into a thin circle. Cut each circle into two equal parts.Take one half circle and form a cone. Fill the cone with vegetable mixture and seal the edges. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan over medium heat. Fry the samosas until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with mint chutney or tamarind chutney.

recipes.name: Curry Shrimp and Rice
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, combine shrimp, curry powder, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and salt. Toss to coat.Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, bell pepper, garlic, and ginger. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add shrimp and cook for 3-4 minutes or until they turn pink. Stir in diced tomatoes and coconut milk. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Serve curry shrimp over cooked white rice. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, whisk together yogurt, lemon juice, paprika, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, salt, garlic, and ginger. Place chicken leg quarters in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour the yogurt mixture over the chicken and massage the bag to evenly coat the chicken. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or up to overnight. Preheat oven to 425°F (218°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Remove chicken from the bag and place on the prepared baking sheet. Discard the remaining marinade. Drizzle vegetable oil over the chicken and use a brush to evenly coat the chicken. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the skin is crispy. Serve tandoori chicken hot with your choice of sides.

recipes.name: Madras Curried Eggs with Rice
recipes.method: In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Add the rice and stir. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes or until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed. While the rice is cooking, place the eggs in a saucepan and cover them with cold water. Bring to a boil and let boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, cover, and let sit for 10 minutes. Drain the water and rinse the eggs under cold water. Peel the eggs and set aside and a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion, red and green bell pepper, and garlic. Cook until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. Add the curry powder, cumin, coriander, and cayenne pepper to the skillet. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until fragrant. Stir in the diced tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 5-10 minutes or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Add the peeled hard-boiled eggs to the skillet and gently stir them into the sauce. Simmer for 2-3 minutes or until the eggs are heated through. Serve the Madras curried eggs hot with the cooked rice. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.

recipes.name: Chickpea & Potato Curry with Rice
recipes.method: Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add the curry powder and stir until fragrant. Add the diced potatoes and cook until slightly softened. Drain and rinse the chickpeas and add them to the pan. Add the coconut milk and simmer until the potatoes are cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala with Rice
recipes.method: In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, ginger, cumin, coriander, paprika, cayenne, cinnamon, salt, and black pepper. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and add to the bowl with the yogurt mixture. Stir to coat the chicken evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight. Preheat the broiler. Line a baking sheet with foil and lightly oil the foil. Thread the chicken onto skewers and place on the prepared baking sheet. Broil for 6 to 8 minutes, or until browned and cooked through. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 8 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Add the crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the cream and simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve the chicken tikka masala with the rice and garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Slow-Cooked Curry Chicken with Rice
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken thighs, bone-in, skin removed
recipes.method: In a slow cooker, combine chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, coconut milk, curry powder, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, and salt. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 3-4 hours, until chicken is tender and cooked through. Serve over cooked rice and garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Cauliflower Tikka Masala
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). In a large bowl, whisk together yogurt, olive oil, garam masala, paprika, turmeric, cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Add cauliflower florets to the bowl and toss to coat with the yogurt mixture. Arrange the coated cauliflower on a baking sheet and bake in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until tender and slightly charred.Meanwhile, heat some olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic and cook until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.Stir in diced tomatoes and heavy cream, and simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Add the roasted cauliflower to the skillet and stir to coat with the sauce. Simmer for another 5 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

name: Deborah N. Seymour
bio: Deborah N. Seymour is a celebrity chef, restaurateur, and television personality. She has owned and operated several Michelin-starred restaurants, and is known for her fiery personality and high culinary standards.

recipes.name: Chicken Samosas
recipes.method: Cook the ground chicken in a pan until browned. Add onion and cook until soft. Add peas, potatoes, and curry powder and cook until vegetables are tender. Spoon filling into prepared samosa pastry and bake until golden brown.

recipes.name: Vegan Butter Cauliflower
ingredients: 1 head of cauliflower, cut into florets
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Place cauliflower florets on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.Add onion, garlic, and ginger and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.Add garam masala, turmeric, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper and stir to combine. Add coconut milk and simmer for 5-10 minutes. Add roasted cauliflower to the skillet and stir to coat with the sauce. Add vegan butter and stir to melt and incorporate into the sauce.

recipes.name: Coconut Red Curry Stew
ingredients: 1 small sweet potato, peeled and diced
recipes.method: Heat coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger and cook until onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Add red pepper, sweet potato, and chickpeas and cook for 5 more minutes. Add coconut milk, curry paste, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and sea salt and stir to combine. Bring to a simmer and let cook for 15-20 minutes or until sweet potato is tender. Add spinach and lime juice and stir until spinach is wilted. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Sheet-Pan Tandoori Chicken
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 425°F. In a large bowl, whisk together the Greek yogurt, lemon juice, tandoori spice mix, and salt. Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat with the yogurt mixture.Spread the chicken out on a sheet pan and add the sliced onions and peppers to the pan. Drizzle everything with olive oil and use your hands to toss everything together until the chicken and vegetables are coated with the oil. Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Easy Chana Masala
recipes.method: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until soft, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute.Add garam masala, cumin, turmeric, and cayenne pepper and cook for 1 minute. Add chickpeas, tomatoes, and water and bring to a simmer.Simmer for 10-15 minutes, until sauce has thickened and chickpeas are heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.Serve with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Slow-Cooker Coconut Curry Chicken
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.method: In a slow cooker, combine the chicken, coconut milk, red bell pepper, onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, salt, and black pepper. Cover and cook on high for 3-4 hours or low for 6-8 hours, until the chicken is cooked through and tender.Stir in the cilantro and serve over rice.

recipes.name: Indian Spiced Chickpea Wraps
recipes.method: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds more.Add the chickpeas, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chickpeas are heated through and coated in the spices.Warm the tortillas in the microwave or on a skillet. To assemble the wraps, divide the chickpea mixture and yogurt between the tortillas. Top with cilantro and a squeeze of lime, if desired. Wrap tightly and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken Thighs
recipes.method: In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, ginger, paprika, cumin, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken thighs and toss to coat them well with the marinade. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Remove the chicken thighs from the marinade and shake off any excess marinade. Arrange the chicken thighs on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake the chicken for 25-30 minutes, until cooked through and browned on the outside. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Slow-Cooker Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
method: Place chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, tomato paste, diced tomatoes, coconut milk, garam masala, cumin, and paprika in a slow cooker. Stir to combine. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until chicken is cooked through.Serve with rice and naan bread.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Curry Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
recipes.method: Place chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, tomatoes, coconut milk, chicken broth, salt, and black pepper in a slow cooker. Stir to combine. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until chicken is tender. In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water. Stir into the slow cooker. Cook on high for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. Serve over cooked rice.

name: Jordan Lansell
bio: Jordan Lansell was a chef, author, and television personality who introduced French cuisine to the American public. He wrote numerous cookbooks and hosted several television shows, including the iconic 'The French Chef.'

bio: Christopher Barlee is a celebrity chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He is known for his simple, healthy approach to cooking and his advocacy for healthier eating habits.

Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 8 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Add the crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the cream and simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve the chicken tikka masala with the rice and garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Slow-Cooked Curry Chicken with Rice
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken thighs, bone-in, skin removed
recipes.method: In a slow cooker, combine chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, coconut milk, curry powder, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, and salt. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 3-4 hours, until chicken is tender and cooked through. Serve over cooked rice and garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Cauliflower Tikka Masala
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). In a large bowl, whisk together yogurt, olive oil, garam masala, paprika, turmeric, cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Add cauliflower florets to the bowl and toss to coat with the yogurt mixture. Arrange the coated cauliflower on a baking sheet and bake in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until tender and slightly charred.Meanwhile, heat some olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic and cook until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.Stir in diced tomatoes and heavy cream, and simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Add the roasted cauliflower to the skillet and stir to coat with the sauce. Simmer for another 5 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

name: Audrey Lapsley
bio: Audrey Lapsley is a chef, author, and television personality. She is known for her sensual approach to cooking and her use of rich, indulgent ingredients. She has written several cookbooks and hosted several television shows.

recipes.name: Chicken Samosas
recipes.method: Cook the ground chicken in a pan until browned. Add onion and cook until soft. Add peas, potatoes, and curry powder and cook until vegetables are tender. Spoon filling into prepared samosa pastry and bake until golden brown.

recipes.name: Vegan Butter Cauliflower
ingredients: 1 head of cauliflower, cut into florets
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Place cauliflower florets on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.Add onion, garlic, and ginger and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.Add garam masala, turmeric, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper and stir to combine. Add coconut milk and simmer for 5-10 minutes. Add roasted cauliflower to the skillet and stir to coat with the sauce. Add vegan butter and stir to melt and incorporate into the sauce.

recipes.name: Coconut Red Curry Stew
ingredients: 1 small sweet potato, peeled and diced
recipes.method: Heat coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger and cook until onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Add red pepper, sweet potato, and chickpeas and cook for 5 more minutes. Add coconut milk, curry paste, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and sea salt and stir to combine. Bring to a simmer and let cook for 15-20 minutes or until sweet potato is tender. Add spinach and lime juice and stir until spinach is wilted. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Sheet-Pan Tandoori Chicken
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 425°F. In a large bowl, whisk together the Greek yogurt, lemon juice, tandoori spice mix, and salt. Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat with the yogurt mixture.Spread the chicken out on a sheet pan and add the sliced onions and peppers to the pan. Drizzle everything with olive oil and use your hands to toss everything together until the chicken and vegetables are coated with the oil. Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Easy Chana Masala
recipes.method: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until soft, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute.Add garam masala, cumin, turmeric, and cayenne pepper and cook for 1 minute. Add chickpeas, tomatoes, and water and bring to a simmer.Simmer for 10-15 minutes, until sauce has thickened and chickpeas are heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.Serve with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Slow-Cooker Coconut Curry Chicken
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.method: In a slow cooker, combine the chicken, coconut milk, red bell pepper, onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, salt, and black pepper. Cover and cook on high for 3-4 hours or low for 6-8 hours, until the chicken is cooked through and tender.Stir in the cilantro and serve over rice.

recipes.name: Indian Spiced Chickpea Wraps
recipes.method: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds more.Add the chickpeas, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chickpeas are heated through and coated in the spices.Warm the tortillas in the microwave or on a skillet. To assemble the wraps, divide the chickpea mixture and yogurt between the tortillas. Top with cilantro and a squeeze of lime, if desired. Wrap tightly and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken Thighs
recipes.method: In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, ginger, paprika, cumin, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken thighs and toss to coat them well with the marinade. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Remove the chicken thighs from the marinade and shake off any excess marinade. Arrange the chicken thighs on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake the chicken for 25-30 minutes, until cooked through and browned on the outside. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Slow-Cooker Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
method: Place chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, tomato paste, diced tomatoes, coconut milk, garam masala, cumin, and paprika in a slow cooker. Stir to combine. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until chicken is cooked through.Serve with rice and naan bread.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Curry Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
recipes.method: Place chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, tomatoes, coconut milk, chicken broth, salt, and black pepper in a slow cooker. Stir to combine. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until chicken is tender. In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water. Stir into the slow cooker. Cook on high for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. Serve over cooked rice.

name: Riley Wadham
bio: Riley Wadham was a chef, author, and television personality. He was known for his adventurous spirit and his love of global cuisine. He wrote several books, including 'Kitchen Confidential,' and hosted several television shows, including 'No Reservations' and 'Parts Unknown.'

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.method: Marinate the chicken in the yogurt for at least 1 hour. In a large skillet, heat the ghee over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute. Add the spices and cook for another minute. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Add the tomato sauce and bring to a simmer. Cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 10 minutes. Stir in the cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice and naan bread.

recipes.name: Mughlai Chicken
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, marinate the chicken with yogurt, cream, ginger paste, garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions and fry until golden brown. Add marinated chicken and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the gravy has thickened. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Vegetable Samosas
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, 2 tablespoons oil, and salt. Add water gradually, and knead to make a smooth dough. Cover with a damp cloth and set aside for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add cumin and coriander seeds, and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add mixed vegetables, turmeric, garam masala, cayenne pepper, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Remove from heat and stir in ginger, garlic, lemon juice, and cilantro.Divide the dough into small balls. Roll out each ball into a thin circle. Cut each circle into two equal parts.Take one half circle and form a cone. Fill the cone with vegetable mixture and seal the edges. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan over medium heat. Fry the samosas until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with mint chutney or tamarind chutney.

recipes.name: Curry Shrimp and Rice
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, combine shrimp, curry powder, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and salt. Toss to coat.Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, bell pepper, garlic, and ginger. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add shrimp and cook for 3-4 minutes or until they turn pink. Stir in diced tomatoes and coconut milk. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Serve curry shrimp over cooked white rice. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, whisk together yogurt, lemon juice, paprika, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, salt, garlic, and ginger. Place chicken leg quarters in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour the yogurt mixture over the chicken and massage the bag to evenly coat the chicken. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or up to overnight. Preheat oven to 425°F (218°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Remove chicken from the bag and place on the prepared baking sheet. Discard the remaining marinade. Drizzle vegetable oil over the chicken and use a brush to evenly coat the chicken. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the skin is crispy. Serve tandoori chicken hot with your choice of sides.

recipes.name: Madras Curried Eggs with Rice
recipes.method: In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Add the rice and stir. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes or until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed. While the rice is cooking, place the eggs in a saucepan and cover them with cold water. Bring to a boil and let boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, cover, and let sit for 10 minutes. Drain the water and rinse the eggs under cold water. Peel the eggs and set aside and a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion, red and green bell pepper, and garlic. Cook until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. Add the curry powder, cumin, coriander, and cayenne pepper to the skillet. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until fragrant. Stir in the diced tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 5-10 minutes or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Add the peeled hard-boiled eggs to the skillet and gently stir them into the sauce. Simmer for 2-3 minutes or until the eggs are heated through. Serve the Madras curried eggs hot with the cooked rice. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.

recipes.name: Chickpea & Potato Curry with Rice
recipes.method: Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add the curry powder and stir until fragrant. Add the diced potatoes and cook until slightly softened. Drain and rinse the chickpeas and add them to the pan. Add the coconut milk and simmer until the potatoes are cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala with Rice
recipes.method: In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, ginger, cumin, coriander, paprika, cayenne, cinnamon, salt, and black pepper. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and add to the bowl with the yogurt mixture. Stir to coat the chicken evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight. Preheat the broiler. Line a baking sheet with foil and lightly oil the foil. Thread the chicken onto skewers and place on the prepared baking sheet. Broil for 6 to 8 minutes, or until browned and cooked through. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 8 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Add the crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the cream and simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve the chicken tikka masala with the rice and garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Slow-Cooked Curry Chicken with Rice
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken thighs, bone-in, skin removed
recipes.method: In a slow cooker, combine chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, coconut milk, curry powder, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, and salt. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 3-4 hours, until chicken is tender and cooked through. Serve over cooked rice and garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Cauliflower Tikka Masala
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). In a large bowl, whisk together yogurt, olive oil, garam masala, paprika, turmeric, cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Add cauliflower florets to the bowl and toss to coat with the yogurt mixture. Arrange the coated cauliflower on a baking sheet and bake in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until tender and slightly charred.Meanwhile, heat some olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic and cook until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.Stir in diced tomatoes and heavy cream, and simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Add the roasted cauliflower to the skillet and stir to coat with the sauce. Simmer for another 5 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

name: Makayla Imlay
bio: Makayla Imlay is a chef, author, and television personality. She is known for her elegant, yet approachable recipes, and her popular cooking show, 'Barefoot Contessa.' She has written numerous cookbooks and owned a specialty food store in the Hamptons.

To assemble the wraps, divide the chickpea mixture and yogurt between the tortillas. Top with cilantro and a squeeze of lime, if desired. Wrap tightly and serve immediately.

Cook on high for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. Serve over cooked rice.

name: Harrison Addis
bio: Harrison Addis is a chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He is known for his fusion cuisine, which blends Asian and Western flavors. He has written several cookbooks and hosted several television shows, including 'Simply Ming.'
